contents: Article 15 (Fund Directors) ① Among the standing directors, the directors in charge of affairs related to the management and operation of the National Pension Fund (hereinafter referred to as *Fund Directors) are selected from among those with abundant knowledge and experience in management, economics, and fund operation. shall. Revised May 26, 2015., ② In order to recommend fund director candidates, the Corporation establishes a Fund Director Recommendation Committee chaired by the Chairman and non-standing directors as members., ③ The Fund Director Recommendation Committee publishes fund director candidates in major daily newspapers. The recruitment of directors must be announced, and separately, fund director candidates who are judged to be suitable candidates may be investigated or a professional organization may be requested to conduct an investigation. Fund director candidates must be reviewed in accordance with the established fund director candidate screening standards, and the terms of the contract must be discussed with the person to be recommended as a fund director candidate. Revised January 5, 2022, ⑤ The Chairman of the Board shall recommend fund director candidates to the Minister of Health and Welfare according to the results of the review and consultation under Paragraph 4 and submit a contract draft at the same time. ⑥ Submitted in accordance with Paragraph 5. When the Minister of Health and Welfare approves the recommendation and contract proposal for a fund director candidate, the chairman of the board must enter into a contract with the fund director candidate. Revised January 5, 2022, ⑦ The submission of fund director candidate recommendations and contract drafts pursuant to Paragraph 5 and approval pursuant to Paragraph 6 shall be regarded as the recommendation and appointment of standing directors pursuant to Article 30 Paragraph 2 of the Act, respectively. Revised 2022. 1. 5.
